tasks.task: Analyze the impact of irrigation methods on soil health and plant vitality
subtasks: Understand the composition of soil and the crucial role of organisms within it
Differentiate between "dirt" and "soil," emphasizing the latter's biological components
Explain the relationship between organic matter, water, and soil organisms
Compare natural rainfall with alternative irrigation systems (microsprays, drip systems) and their effects on soil moisture and organism survival
Evaluate the role of soil porosity (clay vs. sandy) in water distribution and capillary action

tasks.task: Identify strategies for water conservation while maintaining soil health
subtasks: Encourage full soil irrigation rather than targeted plant bases
Recommend the use of mulch (compost) to reduce evaporation and prevent capillary draw in clay soils
Suggest raising drip emitters to expose organic matter to sufficient moisture
Advocate for weather-based irrigation timers to optimize water use
Emphasize the importance of adjusting irrigation schedules based on weather conditions
